channel.title: How to USE rs2dv
channel.description:
[size=8pt][b]If you attempt this on a different source than rs2dv, then you are the dumbest idiot to have come on MoparScape. Thanks.[/b][/size]
[b]Before you start:[/b] [i] Learn java. Get the rs2dv source. Also, if you are missing a brain, attempt to gain one. [/i]
[b]Why rs2dv?[/b] [i] Rs2dv is the best framework and closest thing you can get to scratch without actually DOING scratch. This is also very stable and a number of other things. [/i]
[b]What will I get out of this?[/b] [i] When we are done you SHOULD have your rs2dv source with a basic command class and some idle packets fixed. [/i]
[b] This guide has absolutely NO pictures [size=7pt][except at the end for an example.][/size], so you MUST be able to understand things WITHOUT pictures. I am NOT wasting my time taking pictures of something THIS SIMPLE to comprehend. [/b]
[b] Process; [/b]
[b] Section 1 - Windows [/b] [i] If you do NOT have [url=http://ant.apache.org]Apache Ant[/url], GET it. Installing Ant: http://ant.apache.org/manual/install.html#installing[/i]
There is a good tutorial for setting up rs2dv on Windows, written by m.dog311.. The link is [b][url=http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,284847.0.html]here.[/url][/b]
[b] Section 2 - Mac OS X [/b] [i]Luckily, Mac COMES with Ant! How useful![/i]
We cannot open SH files, unless we did manually, but, hey- I am NOT complaining, I found a way that made this easier. Open [b]Terminal[/b]. [i]I will not explain every command thoroughly, therefore it is recommended you know Terminal before using it.[/i] [b]cd[/b] to your directory where rs2d is (For me, it was /usr/dev/dv)
Do: [b]cp custom-build.xml build.xml && rm -f custom-build.xml[/b] [i]This copies custom-build.xml into the [empty] file build.xml, then it deletes the file custom-build.xml.[/i]
Do: [b]ant[/b] [i]Yes, only a 3 letter command, but all that effective. This will compile the source and dump it in build/[/i]
Do: [b]cd build && mkdir logs[/b] [i]rs2dv has issues when you run it from build directory; so yeah- we make the logs directory here instead.[/i]
This next part may seem a bit complicated to you, but don't worry. I'll walk you through it the best I can. [i]Before we can run rs2dv, we have to add the packages necessary.. Instead of extracting the ones it comes with, I zipped the files needed to make it A LOT easier on me AND you.[/i]
[b] IMPORTANT: UNTIL MY COMPUTER THAT IS USED TO HOST THIS STUFF IS ALIVE AGAIN, please use the updated instructions. [/b]
[s] Do: [b]curl -O http://rs2reborn.net/org.zip[/b] (380kb) [i]This will grab the required files (apache mina (networking), commons (logging sort of I THINK.), and slfj4 (logging.))[/i] [/s]
Download the following file with your browser of choice: http://rapidshare.com/files/151130164/org.zip Copy it to your build folder for rs2dv. Do not extract it, that is what we are doing next.
Do: [b]unzip org.zip && rm -f org.zip[/b] [i]This will unzip the file org.zip and then finally remove it.[/i]
Alright, finally we can start rs2dv! Do: [b]java net.varek.rs2d.test.Main[/b] [i]DO NOT cd to the test folder and try java Main, YOU WILL [B]FAIL[/B][/i]
The terminal SHOULD come up something like this: [code]iSore:/usr/dev/dv/build root# java net.varek.rs2d.test.Main [00:00:00] [main] Loaded world [00:00:00] [main] Added packet handler: net.varek.rs2d.test.QuietPacketHandler@af993e (binds=[0, 86, 210, 121, 3, 77, 202]) [00:00:00] [main] Added packet handler: net.varek.rs2d.test.DebuggingPacketHandler@64ea66 (binds=[]) [00:00:00] [main] Added packet handler: net.varek.rs2d.packethandler.Walking@58f9d3 (binds=[164, 98, 248]) [00:00:00] [main] Added packet handler: net.varek.rs2d.packethandler.ActionButton@79a2e7 (binds=[185]) [00:00:00] [main] Added packet handler: net.varek.rs2d.packethandler.PublicChat@b60280 (binds=[4]) [00:00:01] [main] Listening on port 43594[/code] [i]If you got this, then CONGRATULATIONS YOU DO NOT, AND I MEAN THIS- [b]FAIL[/b]![/i]
[b] Section 3 - Adding 2 Idle packets and Commands (packet 103) [/b] [i]This section is for the idiots who can't figure out how to add packets.[/i]
Go in the source folder, then to net/varek/rs2d. Now you should see a bunch of folders and file names.. Open [b]test/Main.java[/b]
Import [b]net.varek.rs2d.packethandler.Command[/b] in Main.java Now Go down until you see [b]handleIds = new int[][][/b] ..
See the first line? [code]{ 0, 86, 210, 121, 3 },[/code]
Add packets [b]77[/b], [b]202[/b], and [b]241[/b] to it. This will make them silent, and not do anything. (They don't do anything, anyway! It just annoys the hell outta terminal with spam.)
Last line? [code]{ 4 }[/code]
Add this after it: [code] { 103 } [/code] and of course a comma after the { 4 } one.
after [b]new PublicChat()[/b] (down a bit...) add [b]new Command()[/b]
[b] Close[/b] Main.java.. Make a new file in [b]packethandler[/b] folder called [b]Command.java[/b]. Open it.
These are the headers: [code] /* * Command.java * * Created on May 10th. * * Author: Hidendra < hid.en.dra@hotmail.com > * */
package net.varek.rs2d.packethandler;
import net.varek.rs2d.model.Player; import net.varek.rs2d.net.Packet; import net.varek.rs2d.model.Point; import net.varek.rs2d.net.ActionSender; import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession; [/code] [i]Basically just importing some stuff and naming the package.
[b]Class[/b] [code] public class Command implements PacketHandler {
public void handlePacket(Packet p, IoSession session) { // handle packet [103] ; commands Player player = (Player)session.getAttachment(); String c = p.readRS2String(); ActionSender s = player.getActionSender();
}
} [/code] [i]What this does is the server sends any packet 103's data to handlePacket() in Command.java.. And we have to handle it. The player is for you to use for whatever... [b]String c[/b] is the actual command, in most servers readString() is used, in this readString() adds a new line.. readRS2String() works perfectly.
[b]ActionSender s[/b] is the name of most common variables. Let's add a simple command below this (in handlePacket):
[code] if(c.equalsIgnoreCase("hello")) { s.sendMessage("Hello world!"); } [/code] [i]When you type ::hello in-game it will respond with [b]Hello world![/b][/i]
Now build and run. Windows: [b]build.bat, run.bat..[/b] Mac: Terminal: [b] cd to the dir (unless you kept Terminal open!) ant cd build && java net.varek.rs2d.test.Main [/b]
If you get any errors, then I MAY have made a mistake, or most likely [b]you[/b] have! Most code I checked over and made sure it worked (definitely Mac sides since I use a Mac.)
Pic- http://img84.imageshack.us/img84/5397/commandaz9.png
Thanks for reading! This guide was pretty long, but I hope it wasn't too hard to understand. [i]If you flame, well just don't. If you have feedback, post it. Whatever else- post it.[/i]
[i]Edit; fixed Apache ant link 2; fixed some other stuff. 3; fixed some stuff, again. 4; temporary instructions for a [u]rapidshare[/u] mirror...[/i]

item.title: How to USE rs2dv
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Gettin an error when i try to run: system cant find logs/out.log
Anyone know how to solve this? thanks.

Edit. Fixed that to, have to make the folder “logs” yourself, and make a new file called out.log

Managed to get this server running. And now theres the next problem. Logging in.
When i log in with a 317 deob client i disconnect inmediatly.

Read full topic

item.title: How to USE rs2dv
item.dc:creator: @legendaryskittle legendaryskittle
item.description:
@legendaryskittle wrote:

Hey thanks for this Hidendra. The source here is crazy cleaner that the other sources I’ve seen.

I’ll fuck around with this a bit and see if I can produce anything useful

EDIT: Since I’m very new to this source, I have a couple questions for anyone who’d like to help. (Also, inb4 lern2program )

  1. So my first question: Is the ActionSender class is where the magic happens? So if I wanted to add combat or some other player action, I would create a function inside the ActionSender class for it?

  2. I noticed this in StaticPacketBuilder.java in the “sendEquipment(int type)” method

		StaticPacketBuilder equip = new StaticPacketBuilder().setId(34)
				.addShort(1688)
				.addByte((byte)type)
				.addShort(itemId);

I know that the number “34” is an ID number. Question is, if I wanted to implement combat, can I just stick some random ID number in there (making sure there are no duplicates) and have it work? And finally, what is the purpose of ‘1688’ in .addShort(1688) Is it just some random value?

EDIT2: After about 4 hours of researching (lol), I guess the client itself has all of the NPC code / Item code and whatnot?

Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: How to USE rs2dv
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“M4G3OWNS, post:219, topic:204818”]This may sound stupid but what the hell do u mean “Open terminal” you never said anything about terminal in ur post, im half asleep dont blame me >.>

EDIT: what the HELL is terminal -_-[/quote]
on mac -> Spotlight, type Terminal in spotlight. or go to applications then utilities.
if you’re on windows it won’t apply to you, windows uses batch, *nix doesn’t.
Terminal is, in short, a text based way of controlling your computer. If you’re going to be downloading the org.zip , well it won’t work, I don’t have it anymore. If you really need it, pm me and I can probably remake it.

Read full topic

item.title: How to USE rs2dv
item.dc:creator: @surfer25 surfer25
item.description:
@surfer25 wrote:

[quote=“archerkill30, post:214, topic:204818”][quote author=Hidendra link=topic=270348.msg2269685#msg2269685 date=1213173579]
setCombatLevel is already in rs2dv. But not really a combat system, just setting the combat level.
I probably won’t exactly teach anything regarding rs2dv for a few weeks more… With real life and such, but this community obviously was not ready for rs2dv.

I speak for some or even most of mscp- most of them still think a wL-based server is the best thing out there and still ask questions in the tutorial section.
Anyway, I’ll stop ranting now.

When you learn how to use packets in rs2dv, then you should be able to do everything. So, I am not doing everyone’s work for them.
[/quote]

So let me get this straight? you coded this so called “rs2dv” you release it and when we ask you how to work it you tell us were not ready!? fuck you. we just have no idea where to start. most of us cant work from scratch thats why we need tutorials and some instructions for a week or 2 so we can get the hang of it. Use your head. thats like inventing a skateboard and giving it to a 10 year and and telling him to do an kickflip. thats fucked up.[/quote]

Learn java dick head

Read full topic

item.title: How to USE rs2dv
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“archerkill30, post:214, topic:204818”][quote author=Hidendra link=topic=270348.msg2269685#msg2269685 date=1213173579]
setCombatLevel is already in rs2dv. But not really a combat system, just setting the combat level.
I probably won’t exactly teach anything regarding rs2dv for a few weeks more… With real life and such, but this community obviously was not ready for rs2dv.

I speak for some or even most of mscp- most of them still think a wL-based server is the best thing out there and still ask questions in the tutorial section.
Anyway, I’ll stop ranting now.

When you learn how to use packets in rs2dv, then you should be able to do everything. So, I am not doing everyone’s work for them.
[/quote]

So let me get this straight? you coded this so called “rs2dv” you release it and when we ask you how to work it you tell us were not ready!? fuck you. we just have no idea where to start. most of us cant work from scratch thats why we need tutorials and some instructions for a week or 2 so we can get the hang of it. Use your head. thats like inventing a skateboard and giving it to a 10 year and and telling him to do an kickflip. thats fucked up.[/quote]
I didn’t create rs2dv, try looking in the downloads section.
Do you even know what the hell you’re talking about? I did this tutorial to prove rs2dv was usable, and I myself didn’t even think it’d get a sticky, so I didn’t have plans for adding to it, but if I did have plans to adding onto it I would have.
When you say “we”, are you talking about Moparscape as a whole? When I said obviously this community wasn’t ready for rs2dv, at the time they obviously weren’t, but when most people stop asking for c|p and stop asking to be spoon fed, and want to learn, then they might ask for teaching tutorials, while few people are asking for tutorials to teach them now.
A few months ago no tutorial taught you shit, place this here, put that there, change this to ___, compile done. On another unmentionable site, basically every tutorial is c|p, what do you gain there? More credit to give to someone else, all you did was copy and paste. With learning you can at least add on and create more, while don’t get me wrong some people can learn with c|p somehow, actual explanations will help those who can’t and help the people who can learn from c|p learn even more.

One last thing, have you ever tried using rs2dv? It’s not wL so there is no client.java.

Read full topic

Use your head. thats like inventing a skateboard and giving it to a 10 year and and telling him to do an kickflip. thats fucked up.

item.title: How to USE rs2dv
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“DonnyB4e56, post:211, topic:204818”]Import net.varek.rs2d.packethandler.Command in the Main.java file.
Capital I not lowercase i

Now Go down until you see handleIds = new id[][] …

It’s not new id it’s new int[/quote]

First when you said my line was wrong about Import, was it bolded? No. It was a start of a sentence, not a c|p snippet… The part that you could’ve c|p’d was bolded, it’s not hard to type import, so I didnt bother.

Hidendra:

Import net.varek.rs2d.packethandler.Command in the Main.java file.

Secondly, I didn’t notice that, thanks. I changed it.

Read full topic

item.title: How to USE rs2dv
item.dc:creator: @Mrs_Extro_Limited Mrs Extro Limited
item.description:
@Mrs_Extro_Limited wrote:

[quote=“stormcutter, post:203, topic:204818”]I just got rs2dv to work and run, but it gets crashed so easily! I tried using syi and it crashed in about 2 seconds rofl. As said by many people, its supposed to be resistant to ddos but as i see it it cant even handle a few bots.

crahser.jpg758×499
[/quote]
I tested and worked fine.
anyway you need to add the resistance of the syi pker.
and i also tested how many players it can handle and i went over 500!

Read full topic
